attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NBMqIZeZV2YYpcLf2LQ_trigger
attribs.current: A creature within 30 feet attempts and fails to Cast a Spell while stupefied;

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NBMqIZeZV2YYpcLf2LQ_description
attribs.current: Effect The loreavor gains use of the failed spell as an occult innate spell. It can cast that spell once; if the spell is of a higher level than half the loreavors level (5th level or higher for most loreavors), the loreavor must succeed at a flat check with a DC equal to 5 + the level of the spell it is attempting to cast; on a failure, the spell fails, and the loreavor becomes stupefied 1 for 1 minute. If the spell isnt cast within 24 hours, or if the loreavor uses Reconstruct Spell again before casting the spell, the spell is lost. No more than one loreavor can reconstruct a given spell this way.

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-NBMqRZPneXcBE4Z4Bmc_description
attribs.current: The loreavor senses all non-mindless creatures at the listed range.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBMqgLl1T-uaiHZSNIm_description
attribs.current: DC 28; 4th modify memory (at will); Constant (5th) tongues; Cantrips (5th) mage hand

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBMqkA9GDJa2t45jwC1_description
attribs.current: When the loreavor damages a creature with its touch Strike, the creature must succeed at a 28 Will save or become stupefied 1, or stupefied 2 on a critical failure.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBMqpyAKE6JNTNErZME_description
attribs.current: By spending an hour in contact with a nonmagical document or piece of artwork no larger than 1 Bulk, a loreavor can consume either a few words from the text or render the artistry of the work more mundane. Doing so heals the loreavor of 4d8 HP. Words fade from the text, leaving an obvious blank space behind, while artwork is reduced in worth by 10% of its original value. A loreavor can consume incidental text in this manner from a spellbook but cannot consume actual spells recorded in the book. The loreavor cant use Redact for 24 hours.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMr6fweqHVqlWxhZ79_target
attribs.current: 1 Unattended Object of 1 Bulk or Less

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMr6fweqHVqlWxhZ79_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) A loreavor can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.
Heightened (5th) The range increases to 60 feet, and a loreavor can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.
Heightened (7th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMr6fweqHVqlWxhZ79_description
attribs.current: A loreavor create a single magical hand, either invisible or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and moves it slowly up to 20 feet. Because the loreavor's levitating the object, it can move it in any direction. When the loreavor Sustain the Spell, it can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMr8Er63bxiUpXRzPd_description
attribs.current: The target can understand all words regardless of language and also speak the languages of other creatures. When in a mixed group of creatures, each time the target speaks, it can choose a creature and speak in a language that creature understands, even if the target doesn't know what language that is.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMr9Xkh28kZWVhMNi5_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (6th) A loreavor can cast the spell on a willing target to suppress all memory of a particular topic, detailed in 50 words or fewer. The effect is permanent, and it patches these omissions with an indistinct haze.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMr9Xkh28kZWVhMNi5_description
attribs.current:
A loreavor alters the target's memories, either erasing a memory, enhancing a memory's clarity, altering a memory, or adding a false memory. The target can attempt a Will save to resist the spell.
Any memories the loreavor altered remain changed as long as the spell is active. If the target moves out of range before the 5 minutes is up, the loreavor can't alter any further memories.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMr9Xkh28kZWVhMNi5_save_failure
attribs.current: During the first 5 minutes of the spell's duration, the loreavor can Sustain the Spell to modify a memory once each round. When the loreavor does, it imagine up to 6 seconds of memory to modify, to a maximum of 5 continuous minutes of memory.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMr9Xkh28kZWVhMNi5_save_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected but thinks the loreavor's spell was something harmless instead of modify memory, unless it identifies the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMr9Xkh28kZWVhMNi5_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and realizes the loreavor tried to alter its memory.

attribs.name: saving_throws_notes
attribs.current: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-NBMsgZOE5boVsx-QUoS_description
attribs.current: The scarlet walker can sense living creatures with blood in their veins, as well as undead that feed on blood (such as vampires).

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NBMslxJ0lgmtC1wU1lG_description
attribs.current: 20 feet. When a living, nonscarlet walker creature ends its turn in the aura, it must attempt a DC 29 Fortitude save to prevent thin streams of blood from streaming from its eyes and into the eyeless pits in the scarlet walkers face. On a failed save, the victim becomes drained 1 (drained 2 on a critical failure) and sickened 1 from the pain.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NBMssl7xJI5Mfyl5Ys0_description
attribs.current: The scarlet walker doesnt breathe and is immune to effects that require breathing (such as an inhaled poison).

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBMtCst8rcbGmNrD181_description
attribs.current: DC 32; 6th feeblemind, true seeing, vampiric exsanguination; 5th mind probe, sending (3), subconscious suggestion; 4th confusion (3); Constant (6th) air walk, Cantrip (6th) daze

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBMtIdQBlLYUpvzdMp7_description
attribs.current: The scarlet walker can fit through tight spaces as if it were a Medium creature. While Squeezing, it can move at its full Speed.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBMtMBi3gUKAsXhutcA_description
attribs.current:
Any living, nonscarlet walker creature hit by a scarlet walkers tentacle Strike must attempt a Fortitude save.
Critical Success The creature is unaffected.
Success The creature is slowed 1 for 1 round.
Failure The creature is paralyzed for 1 round, and is then slowed 1 for 1 round after recovering.
Critical Failure As failure, but the paralysis doesnt automatically end after 1 round. The creature can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMuPvaFkJT9UztY6yH_description
attribs.current: A scarlet walker clouds the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to the scarlet walker's charisma modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also stunned 1.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMuR1iMbcemxh4cMnX_description
attribs.current: The target can walk on air as if it were solid ground. It can ascend and descend in this way at a maximum of a 45-degree angle.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMuT8Uy-FKLk6BF1Il_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (8th) A scarlet walker can target up to 10 creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMuT8Uy-FKLk6BF1Il_description
attribs.current: A scarlet walker befuddles its target with strange impulses, causing it to act randomly. The effects are determined by the target's Will save. The scarlet walker can Dismiss the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMuT8Uy-FKLk6BF1Il_save_failure
attribs.current: The target is confused for 1 minute. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns to end the confusion.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMuT8Uy-FKLk6BF1Il_save_success
attribs.current: The target babbles incoherently and is stunned 1.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMuT8Uy-FKLk6BF1Il_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target is confused for 1 minute, with no save to end early.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMuUpap9Vd8jXuw0R8_description
attribs.current: A scarlet walker casts its thoughts through a creature's mind, sifting for information. The scarlet walker accesses the target's memories and knowledge unless it fends it off with a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMuUpap9Vd8jXuw0R8_save_failure
attribs.current: Each round of the spell's duration, the scarlet walker can Sustain the Spell to ask a different question and attempt to uncover the answer. For each question, the target can attempt a Deception check against the scarlet walker's spell DC; if the target succeeds, the scarlet walker doesn't learn the answer, and on a critical success, the target gives you a false answer that the scarlet walker believes is truthful Once the scarlet walker asked the target a given question, asking it again, even with a separate casting of mind probe, produces the same result.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMuUpap9Vd8jXuw0R8_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: As failure, and the target takes a 4 circumstance penalty to Deception checks against the scarlet walker's questions.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMvAB5gc7KFJVZuRbS_target
attribs.current: 1 Creature with Whom You are Familiar

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMvAB5gc7KFJVZuRbS_description
attribs.current: A scarlet walker sends the creature a mental message of 25 words or fewer, and it can respond immediately with its own message of 25 words or fewer.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMwjpzf4f39U00CKOd_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (9th) A scarlet walker can target up to 10 creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMwjpzf4f39U00CKOd_description
attribs.current: A scarlet walker implants a subconscious suggestion deep within the target's mind for them to follow when a trigger it specifies occurs. The scarlet walker suggests a course of action to the target. The scarlet walker's directive must be phrased in such a way as to seem like a logical course of action to the target, and it can't be self-destructive or obviously against the target's self-interest. The target must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMwjpzf4f39U00CKOd_save_failure
attribs.current: The suggestion remains in the target's subconscious until the next time the scarlet walker prepares. If the trigger occurs before then, the target immediately follows the scarlet walker's suggestion. The effect has a duration of 1 minute, or until the target has completed a finite suggestion or the suggestion becomes self-destructive or has other obvious negative effects.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMwjpzf4f39U00CKOd_save_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and thinks the scarlet walker is talking to them normally, not casting a spell on them.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMwjpzf4f39U00CKOd_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: As failure, but the duration is 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMwjpzf4f39U00CKOd_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and knows the scarlet walker tried to control it.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMwlrrGe5PhMKZ-nZI_description
attribs.current: A scarlet walker drastically reduce the target's mental faculties. The target must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMwlrrGe5PhMKZ-nZI_save_failure
attribs.current: The target is stupefied 4 with an unlimited duration.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMwlrrGe5PhMKZ-nZI_save_success
attribs.current: The target is stupefied 2 for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMwlrrGe5PhMKZ-nZI_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target's intellect is permanently reduced below that of an animal, and it treats its Charisma, Intelligence, and Wisdom modifiers as 5. It loses all class abilities that require mental faculties, including all spellcasting. If the target is a PC, they become an NPC under the GM's control.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMwnH7obmHygLC5Qk-_description
attribs.current: A scarlet walker sees things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether the scarlet walker sees through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, the scarlet walker can see the creature's true form, but it doesn't end the polymorph spell).

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBMwp6rarGUdZqTI6rW_description
attribs.current:
A scarlet walker draws in the blood and life force of other creatures through its outstretched arms. The scarlet walker deals 12d6 negative damage to living creatures in the area. 
The scarlet walker gains temporary Hit Points equal to half the damage a single creature takes from this spell; calculate these temporary Hit Points using the creature that took the most damage. The scarlet walker loses any remaining temporary Hit Points after 1 minute.

attribs.name: hit_points_notes
attribs.current: Coffin Restoration, Fast Healing 10, Negative Healing

attribs.name: immunities
attribs.current: Death Effects, Disease, Paralyze, Poison, Sleep

attribs.name: resistances
attribs.current: All Physical 15 (Except Magical Silver Weapons or Magical Weapons Shedding Bright Light)

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBNBXjtuApkK9p3TZQL_description
attribs.current:
DC 33, attack +25; 7th (2 slots) eclipse burst, ethereal jaunt, finger of death; 6th (3 slots) blade barrier, spirit blast, true seeing, vampiric exsanguination*; 5th (3 slots) flame strike*, gentle repose, sending, tongues; 4th (3 slots) dimensional anchor, divine wrath*, remove curse, talking corpse; 3rd (3 slots) blindness, chilling darkness*, fear, heal; 2nd (3 slots) comprehend language, dispel magic*, see invisibility, undetectable alignment; 1st (3 slots) command, harm*, ray of enfeeblement, sanctuary; Cantrips (7th) detect magic, divine lance, message, read aura, shield, sigil
*Spells marked with an asterisk are signature spells; the strigoi progenitor may heighten these spells freely.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBNC9p8yH7NTSeZW1XG_description
attribs.current: When drinking essence, the strigoi progenitor regains 18 HP.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBNCX6IIBJkANNbLLYF_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) A striogi progenitor learns the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which the striogi progenitor learn.
Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but a striogi progenitor also pinpoints the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, the striogi progenitor doesn't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBNCX6IIBJkANNbLLYF_description
attribs.current:
A striogi progenitor sends out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. The striogi progenitor receives no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. The striogi progenitor can choose to ignore magic they're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of they and their allies.
The striogi progenitor detects illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the level of their detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBNCY6LeaNH3L4UYipN_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor unleashes a beam of divine energy. Choose an alignment the striogi progenitor's deity has (evil or lawful). Make a ranged spell attack roll against the target's AC. On a hit, the target takes damage of the chosen alignment type equal to 1d4 + the striogi progenitor's charisma modifier (double damage on a critical hit). The spell gains the trait of the alignment the striogi progenitor chose.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBNCZzel9pa7E1NyUbr_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (3rd) The spell's range increases to 500 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBNCZzel9pa7E1NyUbr_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor mouths words quietly, but instead of coming out of their mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear the striogi progenitor's words any better than if they normally mouthed them, the target can hear their words as if they were standing next to them. The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see the striogi progenitor and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to their ear, just like the original message.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBNCa0Hohx8Q3x7rbYz_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) A striogi progenitor can target up to 10 objects.
Heightened (6th) A striogi progenitor can target any number of objects.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBNCa0Hohx8Q3x7rbYz_description
attribs.current:
A striogi progenitor focuses on the target object, opening their mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, the striogi progenitor knows whether that item is magical, and if it is, they learn the school of magic.
If the object is illusory, the striogi progenitor detects this only if the effect's level is lower than the level of their read aura spell.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBNCbbqCujxmo4rtb7J_duration
attribs.current: Until the Start of Your Next Turn

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBNCbbqCujxmo4rtb7J_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.
Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.
Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.
Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.
Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBNCbbqCujxmo4rtb7J_description
attribs.current:
A striogi progenitor raises a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of the striogi progenitor's next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.
While the spell is in effect, the striogi progenitor can use the Shield Block reaction with their magic shield (see the sidebar). The shield has Hardness 5. After the striogi progenitor uses Shield Block, the spell ends and they can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, the striogi progenitor can use the spell's reaction against the magic missile spell.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBNCcoYNQ77l7ENffQp_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) The sigil instead fades after 1 month.
Heightened (5th) The sigil instead fades after 1 year.
Heightened (7th) The sigil never fades.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBNCcoYNQ77l7ENffQp_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor harmlessly places their unique magical sigil, which is about 1 square inch in size, on the targeted creature or object. The mark can be visible or invisible, and the striogi progenitor can change it from one state to another by using an Interact action to touch the target. The mark can be scrubbed or scraped off with 5 minutes of work. If it's on a creature, it fades naturally over the course of a week. The time before the mark fades increases depending on the striogi progenitor's heightened level.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCeZOrLDXu194HKWv_duration
attribs.current: Until the End of the Target's Next Turn

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCeZOrLDXu194HKWv_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (5th) A striogi progenitor can target up to 10 creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCeZOrLDXu194HKWv_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor shouts a command that's hard to ignore. The striogi progenitor can command the target to approach them, run away (as if it had the fleeing condition), release what it's holding, drop prone, or stand in place. It can't Delay or take any reactions until it has obeyed striogi progenitor's command. The effects depend on the target's Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCeZOrLDXu194HKWv_save_failure
attribs.current: For the first action on its next turn, the creature must use a single action to do as the striogi progenitor commands.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCeZOrLDXu194HKWv_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target must use all its actions on its next turn to obey the striogi progenitor's command.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNChPBDHDLQMUFbA4O_target
attribs.current: 1 Living Creature or 1 Willing Undead Creature

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNChPBDHDLQMUFbA4O_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNChPBDHDLQMUFbA4O_description
attribs.current:
A striogi progenitor channels negative energy to harm the living or heal the undead. If the target is a living creature, the striogi progenitor deals 1d8 negative damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. If the target is a willing undead creature, the striogi progenitor restores that amount of Hit Points. The number of actions the striogi progenitor spends when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.
[one-action] (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.
[two-actions] (somatic, verbal) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If the striogi progenitor's healing an undead creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8.
[three-actions] (material, somatic, verbal) The striogi progenitor disperses negative energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the area.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNClNEWjs1H3ijaUCB_description
attribs.current: A ray with the power to sap a foe's strength flashes from a striogi progenitor's hand. Attempt a ranged spell attack against the target. If the striogi progenitor succeeds, that creature attempts a Fortitude save in order to determine the spell's effect. If the striogi progenitor critically succeeds on their attack roll, use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of its save.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCmtTZzh6J8LgZpDR_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor wards a creature with protective energy that deters enemy attacks. Creatures attempting to attack the target must attempt a Will save each time. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCmtTZzh6J8LgZpDR_save_failure
attribs.current: The creature can't attack the target and wastes the action. It can't attempt further attacks against the target this turn.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCmtTZzh6J8LgZpDR_save_success
attribs.current: The creature can attempt its attack and any other attacks against the target this turn.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCmtTZzh6J8LgZpDR_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The creature wastes the action and can't attempt to attack the target for the rest of sanctuary's duration.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCogD34x9Q5OoAmsh_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) The target can also speak the language.
Heightened (4th) a striogi progenitor can target up to 10 creatures, and targets can also speak the language.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCogD34x9Q5OoAmsh_description
attribs.current: The target can understand the meaning of a single language it is hearing or reading when A striogi progenitor castS the spell. This doesn't let it understand codes, language couched in metaphor, and the like (subject to GM discretion). If the target can hear multiple languages and knows that, it can choose which language to understand; otherwise, choose one of the languages randomly.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCqCiP3M6X-VFBZmA_target
attribs.current: 1 Spell Effect or Unattended Magic Item

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCqCiP3M6X-VFBZmA_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor unravels the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. Counteracting a Magic Item causes it to become mundane for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artefact or similar item, the striogi progenitor automatically fails.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCrbEYfMxRvI1lRuY_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (5th) The spell has a duration of 8 hours.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCrbEYfMxRvI1lRuY_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor can see invisible creatures and objects. They appear to the striogi progenitor as translucent shapes, and they are concealed to them.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCt97B6xn5Aod7Yhu_duration
attribs.current: Until the Next Time the Striogi Progenitor Makes Their Daily Preparations

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCt97B6xn5Aod7Yhu_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor shrouds a creature or object in wards that hide its alignment. The target appears to be neutral to all effects that would detect its alignment.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCur3mt1h1uWAWSVi_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor blinds the target. The effect is determined by the target 's Fortitude save. The target then becomes temporarily immune for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCur3mt1h1uWAWSVi_save_failure
attribs.current: The target is blinded for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCur3mt1h1uWAWSVi_save_success
attribs.current: The target is blinded until its next turn begins.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCwrY1hwWPm4ott7I_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+1) The cold damage increases by 2d6, and the evil damage against celestials increases by 2d6.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCwrY1hwWPm4ott7I_description
attribs.current:
A striogi progenitor shoots an utterly cold ray of darkness tinged with unholy energy. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. The striogi progenitor deal 5d6 cold damage, plus 5d6 evil damage if the target is a celestial. 
If the ray passes through an area of magical light or targets a creature affected by magical light, chilling darkness attempts to counteract the light. If you need to determine whether the ray passes through an area of light, draw a line between yourself and the spell 's target.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCwrY1hwWPm4ott7I_damage_additional
attribs.current: [[5d6]] Evil Damage if the Target is a Celestial

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCyLWydPDZ2FuAm8w_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (3rd) A striogi progenitor can target up to five creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCyLWydPDZ2FuAm8w_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor plants fear in the target; it must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCyLWydPDZ2FuAm8w_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target is frightened 3 and fleeing for 1 round.

attribs.current: 1 Willing Living Creature or 1 Undead Creature

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCzUDm8waHqLVjaPh_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNCzUDm8waHqLVjaPh_description
attribs.current:
A striogi progenitor channels positive energy to heal the living or damage the undead. If the target is a willing living creature, the striogi progenitor restores 1d8 Hit Points. If the target is undead, they deal that amount of positive damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. The number of actions the striogi progenitor spends when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.
[one-action] (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.
[two-actions] (somatic, verbal) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If the striogi progenitor's healing a living creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8.
[three-actions] (material, somatic, verbal) The striogi progenitor disperse positive energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the burst.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBND0OLKRowltkmbVqb_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor interferes with the target's ability to teleport and travel between dimensions. Dimensional anchor attempts to counteract any teleportation effect, or any effect that would move the target to a different plane. The duration is determined by the target's Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBND1b4nJa8l3EZc17S_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor can channel the fury of their deity against foes of opposed alignment. Choose an alignment their deity has (evil or lawful). This spell gains the trait of the alignment the striogi progenitor chose. The striogi progenitor deals 4d10 damage of the alignment they chose; each creature in the area must attempt a Fortitude save. Creatures that match the alignment the striogi progenitor chose are unaffected. Those that neither match nor oppose it treat the result of their saving throw as one degree better.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBND1b4nJa8l3EZc17S_save_failure
attribs.current: The creature takes full damage and is sickened 1.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBND1b4nJa8l3EZc17S_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The creature takes full damage and is sickened 2; while it is sickened, it is also slowed 1.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBND3-HPtRjgArs0WoN_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor's touch grants a reprieve to a cursed creature. The striogi progenitor attempts to counteract one curse afflicting the target. If the curse comes from a cursed item or other external source, a success indicates that the target creature can rid itself of the cursed item, but it doesn't remove the curse from the item.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBND41Mv5l3XbmH6Gza_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor grants the target corpse a semblance of life, which it uses to speak the answers to three questions posed to it. This spell calls on the physical body's latent memories rather than summoning back the deceased's spirit, so the corpse must be mostly intact for the spell to function. The more damage the corpse has taken, the more inaccurate or patchwork its answers are, and it must have a throat and mouth to speak at all. If anyone has previously cast this spell on the corpse in the last week, the spell automatically fails. The corpse can attempt a Will save to resist answering the questions using the statistics of the original creature at its time of death, with the following effects.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBND41Mv5l3XbmH6Gza_save_failure
attribs.current: The target must answer truthfully, but its answers can be brief, cryptic, and repetitive. It can still mislead the striogi progenitor or attempt to stall so that the spell's duration runs out before they can ask all their questions.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBND41Mv5l3XbmH6Gza_save_success
attribs.current: The target can provide false information or refuse to answer the striogi progenitor's questions.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBND41Mv5l3XbmH6Gza_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: As failure, but the target's answers are more direct and less repetitive, though still cryptic. It takes a 2 status penalty to Deception checks to deceive or mislead the striogi progenitor.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBND41Mv5l3XbmH6Gza_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target can lie or refuse to answer the striogi progenitor's questions, and the target's spirit haunts them for 24 hours, bothering them and causing them to be unable to gain any rest for that time.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBND5xxOI8R9NMiA5wb_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor calls a rain of divine fire that plummets down from above, dealing 8d6 fire damage. Because the flame is infused with divine energy, creatures in the area apply only half their usual fire resistance. Creatures that are immune to fire, instead of gaining the usual benefit of immunity, treat the results of their saving throws as one degree of success better.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBND74Veus4QLxjSmDm_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (5th) The spell's duration is unlimited, but the spell takes one more action to cast and requires a material component and a cost (embalming fluid worth 6 gp).

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBND74Veus4QLxjSmDm_description
attribs.current: The targeted corpse doesn't decay, nor can it be transformed into an undead. If the corpse is subject to a spell that requires the corpse to have died within a certain amount of time (for example, raise dead), do not count the duration of gentle repose against that time. This spell also prevents ordinary bugs and pests (such as maggots) from consuming the body.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBND81zUoE124dQVbsq_target
attribs.current: 1 Creature with Whom the Striogi Progenitor is Familiar

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBND81zUoE124dQVbsq_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor send the creature a mental message of 25 words or fewer, and it can respond immediately with its own message of 25 words or fewer.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBND96nnZp14g1l4a-w_description
attribs.current: Blades of force form a churning wall. The wall is a straight line 20 feet high, 120 feet long, and 2 inches thick, and it provides cover. The wall deals 7d8 force damage to each creature that's in the wall 's space when it is created, that attempts to pass through the wall, or that ends its turn inside the wall. A basic Reflex save reduces the damage. A creature that succeeds at this save when the wall is created is pushed to the nearest space on the side of its choice. Creatures trying to move through the wall fail to do so if they critically fail the save, ending their movement adjacent to the wall.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDA8FkgO9FH9WmQd5_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor concentrates ethereal energy and attack a creature's spirit, dealing 16d6 force damage. Because spirit blast affects the creature's spirit, it can damage a target projecting its consciousness (such as via project image) or possessing another creature even if the target's body is elsewhere. The possessed creature isn't harmed by the blast. The blast doesn't harm creatures that have no spirit, such as constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDBDS5mwti7hSBwgV_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor sees things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether the striogi progenitor see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, the striogi progenitor can see the creature's true form, but they don't end the polymorph spell).

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDCCSmlLfl4t0zUiy_description
attribs.current:
A striogi progenitor draws in the blood and life force of other creatures through their outstretched arms. The striogi progenitor deals 12d6 negative damage to living creatures in the area. 
The striogi progenitor gains temporary Hit Points equal to half the damage a single creature takes from this spell; calculate these temporary Hit Points using the creature that took the most damage. The striogi progenitor lose any remaining temporary Hit Points after 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDDWyjvMOtuhqyE5f_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+1) The cold damage increases by 1d10 and the negative damage against the living increases by 1d4.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDDWyjvMOtuhqyE5f_description
attribs.current:
A globe of freezing darkness explodes in the area, dealing 8d10 cold damage to creatures in the area, plus 8d4 additional negative damage to living creatures. Creatures in the area must attempt a Reflex save. 
If the globe overlaps with an area of magical light or affects a creature affected by magical light, eclipse burst attempts to counteract the light effect.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDDWyjvMOtuhqyE5f_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The creature takes double damage and becomes blinded by the darkness for an unlimited duration.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDEwID8TOgCiOcR-E_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (9th) A striogi progenitor can target up to five additional willing creatures at a range of 30 feet. The duration is up to 10 minutes.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDEwID8TOgCiOcR-E_description
attribs.current:
A striogi progenitor travels to the Ethereal Plane, which overlaps the Material Plane. Material Plane creatures can't see the striogi progenitor, and they can move through things on the Material Plane. The striogi progenitor moves at half their normal Speeds, but can move in any direction (including up and down).
The striogi progenitor can see onto the Material Plane within a radius of 60 feet; it is grey, hazy, and concealed from them. The striogi progenitor can't affect the Material Plane, and they can't be affected by the Material Plane except by force effects and abjurations originating there. 
When the spell ends, the striogi progenitor returns to the Material Plane. If the striogi progenitor's in the air, they fall (unless they can fly), and if they're inside an object, they're pushed into the nearest open space and take 1d6 damage per 5 feet they were pushed.
If the striogi progenitor casts this spell when not on the Material Plane, it is lost.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDGTf4qZQLexk7xFx_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor points their finger toward the target and speak a word of slaying. The striogi progenitor deals 70 negative damage to the target. If the damage from finger of death reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, the target dies instantly.

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-NBNDVS7HcAT95KLJjR7_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+1) The mental damage increases by 1d8.

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-NBNDVS7HcAT95KLJjR7_description
attribs.current: A striogi progenitor probes the targets mind to glean knowledge. This deals 1d8 mental damage with a basic Will save. If the target fails the save, the striogi progenitor sorts through the stolen memories to attempt a single check to Recall Knowledge. Choose a skill that has the Recall Knowledge action, and use the targets skill modifier for the check.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDRANpnR6xWn4rZ-z_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target becomes an Undead creature of the appropriate type. If it's at least 4 levels lower than the strigoi progenitor, they can make it a minion. This gives it the minion trait, meaning it can use 2 Actions when you Command it, and commanding it is a single action that has the auditory and concentrate Traits. The strigoi progenitor can have a maximum of four minions under their Control. If it's intelligent and doesn't become a minion, the Undead is Helpful to the strigoi progenitor for awakening it, though it's still a horrid and evil creature. If it's unintelligent and doesn't become a minion, the strigoi progenitor can give it one simple Command. It pursues that goal singlemindedly, ignoring any of their subsequent commands.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDRANpnR6xWn4rZ-z_save_success
attribs.current: As critical success, except an intelligent Undead that doesn't become the strigoi progenitor's minion is only Friendly to them, and an unintelligent Undead that doesn't become their minion leaves them alone unless they Attack it. It marauds the local area rather than following the strigoi progenitor's Command.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDRANpnR6xWn4rZ-z_save_failure
attribs.current: The strigoi progenitor fails to create the Undead.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDRANpnR6xWn4rZ-z_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The strigoi progenitor creates the Undead, but its soul, tortured by theirfoul Necromancy, is full of nothing but Hatred for them. It attempts to destroy the strigoi progenitor.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDRANpnR6xWn4rZ-z_description
attribs.current:
Secondary Casters 1
Primary Check Arcana (expert), Occultism (expert), or Religion (expert); Secondary Checks Religion

A strigoi progenitor transforms the target into an Undead creature with a level up to that allowed in Table 71. There are many versions of this ritual, each specific to a particular type of Undead (one ritual for all zombies, one for skeletons, one for ghouls, and so on), and the Rituals that create rare Undead are also rare. Some forms of Undead, such as liches, form using their own unique methods and can't be created with a version of create Undead.

attribs.current: Warding Diagram Ingredients Worth a Total Value of 2 gp  the Spell Level  the Target's Level

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDSYIqJkEirVs69N4_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The strigoi progenitor calls the extraplanar creature and bind it in the wards for up to a full day before it returns home, potentially allowing them to negotiate a better deal by threatening to leave it in the wards for the full day.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDSYIqJkEirVs69N4_save_success
attribs.current: The strigoi progenitor calls the extraplanar creature.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDSYIqJkEirVs69N4_save_failure

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDSYIqJkEirVs69N4_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The strigoi progenitor calls something dark and horrible, unbound by their wards, and it immediately attempts to destroy them.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNDSYIqJkEirVs69N4_description
attribs.current:
Secondary Casters 4
Primary Check Arcana (master) or Occultism (master); Secondary Checks Crafting; Diplomacy or Intimidation; Arcana or Occultism (whichever isn't used for the primary check)

A strigoi progenitor calls forth an extraplanar creature of a level no greater than double that of the planar binding ritual's level and attempt to bargain with it. The secondary caster attempting the Crafting check creates a warding diagram to prevent the extraplanar creature from attacking or leaving during the bargain; if that caster fails or critically fails, then instead of the usual Effects of a failure or critical failure of the secondary skill check, the extraplanar creature can Attack or leave instead of negotiate. The strigoi progenitor can also leave out this step, removing the need for a Crafting check, with the same result (if they're summoning a good extraplanar creature they trust, for example). The creature can also Attack or leave if the strigoi progenitor uses any Hostile action against it or if the warding diagram breaks. Once the diagram is complete, the strigoi progenitor and the Secondary Casters each take their places at specific points at the diagram's edge where power concentrates.

The strigoi progenitor conjures the extraplanar creature within their wards and negotiate a deal with it, generally to perform a task for them in exchange for payment. A creature that doesn't wish to negotiate at all can attempt a Will Save to stay on its home plane. Most good and neutral extraplanar Creatures feel that they have something better to do than cater to the whims of mortals and require a significant gift, especially if the strigoi progenitor's task poses significant risks. Evil extraplanar Creatures are more likely to accept a bargain for a lower cost as long as it allows them to wreak havoc on the Material Plane or inflict evil upon The World along the way. Monetary prices usually range from the cost of a consumable item of the creature's level for a short and simple task to a permanent Magic Item of the creature's level or more to persuade the creature to fight alongside the strigoi progenitor. However, some extraplanar Creatures may want payments other than money, such as permission to cast a geas on the strigoi progenitor to fulfill an unspecified later favour or obtain ownership of their soul via an infernal contract. If the strigoi progenitor can't come to an agreement in a reasonable length of time after they've made their case, the extraplanar creature can return from whence it came at any time.

attribs.current: Abyssal, Aklo, Azlanti, Common, Draconic, Dwarven, Elven, Ignan, Infernal, Jotun, Shoanti, Thassilonian, Undercommon, Varisian; Telepathy 300 feet, Tongues

attribs.current: DC 37, attack +29; 8th dispel magic, maze, suggestion; 7th divine decree (lawful or evil), magic missile, teleport; 6th dominate (2), feeblemind, scrying (3), slow; 5th dimension door (at will); Constant (8th) tongues; Cantrips (8th) detect magic, mage hand, message, produce flame, read aura

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBNRjJZp8UYJGs4zOVu_description
attribs.current: DC 37, attack +29; 8th horrid wilting; 7th shadow blast; 6th phantasmal killer; 5th magic missile; 4th invisibility; 3rd mind reading; 2nd mirror image; 1st ray of enfeeblement

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBNRoTK5MdnUBcrF0Og_description
attribs.current: Requirements Any creature adjacent to Lorthact is stupefied, capable of casting prepared arcane spells, and is either immobilized, unconscious, or willing; Effect Lorthact attempts to drain a 1st- through 8th-level prepared spell from the target, who can resist with a successful DC 37 Will saving throw. On a failure or against a willing target, the prepared arcane spell is transferred from that creature as if it were cast, and Lorthact immediately prepares that spell in the same level slot. If he already had a spell prepared in that slot, the previously prepared spell is lost. That creature is then immune to Arcane Absorption for 24 hours.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBNRvSti04RCk2h8I9A_description
attribs.current: As long as Lorthact has one arcane spell prepared in this way, all arcane spells are on his spell list, which allows him to activate items such as scrolls, wands, and staves. He can recharge his staff of power as a prepared spellcaster by using his arcane spell slots. He has one spell slot to prepare arcane spells of each level from 1st to 8th, and can prepare any Common arcane spell in these slots during his daily preparations. The spells listed above represent those he most typically prepares, but given time, he can adjust this selection as needed for the task at hand.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBNS1Uip17hw32Wl0Vy_description
attribs.current: Lorthact takes on the appearance of Volshyenek Ornelos or reverts to his true form. In Volshyeneks form, he loses his fly Speed and claw Strikes, doesnt inflict additional mental damage with his Strikes, and reduces his AC to 34. He gains a +4 status bonus on Deception checks to appear human in this guise.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBNS7KanqodHDH8SGXv_description
attribs.current: Lorthacts staff of power is tipped with a pair of metal tines that grant the weapon the versatile piercing trait.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBNSAgltePfFwjjQ0Jv_description
attribs.current: Any creature that takes mental damage from Lorthacts claws or staff must succeed at a DC 37 Will save or become stupefied 1 (stupefied 2 on a critical failure). Further mental damage dealt by Lorthact increases the value of the stupefied condition by 1 on a failed save to a maximum of stupefied 4. Whenever Lorthact causes a creature to become stupefied in this way, he absorbs some of those thoughts and gains a +1 status bonus on all Will saving throws and Intelligence-, Wisdom-, or Charisma-based skill checks until the end of his next turn

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNSsCEsUQ0NhHyT11c_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) Lorthact learns the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which Lorthact learns.
Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but Lorthact also pinpoint the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, Lorthact doesn't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNSsCEsUQ0NhHyT11c_description
attribs.current:
Lorthact sends out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. Lorthact receives no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. Lorthact can choose to ignore magic he's fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of him and his allies.
Lorthact detects illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the level of his detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNStLkoumJF4UteyMt_target
attribs.current: 1 Unattended Object of 2 Bulk or Less

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNStLkoumJF4UteyMt_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) Lorthact can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.
Heightened (5th) The range increases to 60 feet, and Lorthact can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.
Heightened (7th) The range increases to 60 feet, and Lorthact can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNStLkoumJF4UteyMt_description
attribs.current: Lorthact creates a single magical hand, either invisible or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and moves it slowly up to 20 feet. Because Lorthact's levitating the object, he can move it in any direction. When Lorthact Sustain the Spell, he can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNSvOCElQNuY7VUeqt_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (3rd) The spell's range increases to 500 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNSvOCElQNuY7VUeqt_description
attribs.current: Lorthact mouths words quietly, but instead of coming out of his mouth, they're transferred directly to the ears of the target. While others can't hear Lorthact's words any better than if he  normally mouthed them, the target can hear his words as if they were standing next to him. The target can give a brief response as a reaction, or as a free action on their next turn if they wish, but they must be able to see Lorthact and be within range to do so. If they respond, their response is delivered directly to Lorthact's ear, just like the original message.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNSwY91iaYOFnUDDHg_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+1) Increase the damage by 1d4 and the persistent damage on a critical hit by 1d4.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNSwY91iaYOFnUDDHg_description
attribs.current: A small ball of flame appears in the palm of Lorthact's hand, and he lashes out with it either in melee or at range. Make a spell attack roll against Lorthact's target's AC. This is normally a ranged attack, but Lorthact can also make a melee attack against a creature in his unarmed reach. On a success, Lorthact deals 1d4 fire damage plus his charisma modifier. On a critical success, the target takes double damage and 1d4 persistent fire damage.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNSwY91iaYOFnUDDHg_damage_additional
attribs.current: [[8d4]] Persistent Fire Damage on a Critical Hit

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT3JnWPMQm9iKagpZ_description
attribs.current:
Lorthact magically spies on a creature of his choice. Scrying works like clairvoyance, except that the image Lorthact receives is less precise, insufficient for teleport and similar spells. Instead of creating an eye in a set location within 500 feet, Lorthact instead create an eye that manifests just above the target. Lorthact can choose a target either by name or by touching one of its possessions or a piece of its body. If Lorthact hasn't met the target in person, scrying's DC is 2 lower, and if he is unaware of the target's identity (perhaps because Lorthact found an unknown creature's fang at a crime scene), the DC is instead 10 lower.
The effect of scrying depends on the target's Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT3JnWPMQm9iKagpZ_save_success
attribs.current: The spell fails and the target is temporarily immune for 1 day.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT3JnWPMQm9iKagpZ_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The spell succeeds, and the eye follows the target if it moves, traveling up to 60 feet per round.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT3JnWPMQm9iKagpZ_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The spell fails and the target is temporarily immune for 1 week. The target also gains a glimpse of Lorthact and learns its rough distance and direction from him.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT494IUA5m-1Ia9Yf_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (6th) You can target up to 10 creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT494IUA5m-1Ia9Yf_description
attribs.current: Lorthact dilates the flow of time around the target, slowing its actions.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT494IUA5m-1Ia9Yf_save_failure
attribs.current: The target is slowed 1 for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT494IUA5m-1Ia9Yf_save_success
attribs.current: The target is slowed 1 for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT494IUA5m-1Ia9Yf_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target is slowed 2 for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT660L5AbB-Tm9r0Z_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 1d10, and the level of creatures that must attempt a second save on a critical failure increases by 2.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT660L5AbB-Tm9r0Z_description
attribs.current: Lorthact utters a potent litany from his faith, a mandate that harms those who oppose his ideals. Choose an alignment Lorthact's deity has (evil or lawful). This spell gains the trait of the alignment Lorthact chose. Lorthact deals 7d10 damage to creatures in the area; each creature must attempt a Fortitude save. Creatures with an alignment that matches the one Lorthact chose are unaffected by the spell. Those that neither match nor oppose it treat the result of their saving throw as one degree better and don't suffer effects other than damage.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT660L5AbB-Tm9r0Z_save_failure
attribs.current: The creature takes full damage and is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT660L5AbB-Tm9r0Z_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The creature takes double damage and is enfeebled 2 for 1 minute. On your home plane, a creature that critically fails is banished with the effect of a failed banishment save. A 10th-level creature or lower must attempt a Will save. On a failure, it's paralyzed for 1 minute; on a critical failure, it dies.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT76FtUbl-wZZA9Hw_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+2) Lorthact shoot one additional missile with each action he spends.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT76FtUbl-wZZA9Hw_description
attribs.current: Lorthact sends a dart of force streaking toward a creature that he can see. It automatically hits and deals 1d4+1 force damage. For each additional action Lorthact uses when Casting the Spell, increase the number of missiles he shoots by one, to a maximum of three missiles for 3 actions. Lorthact chooses the target for each missile individually. If Lorthact shoots more than one missile at the same target, combine the damage before applying bonuses or penalties to damage, resistances, weaknesses, and so forth.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT8LAlUeEJHgsR4h0_target
attribs.current: Lorthact and Up to 4 Targets Touched, Either Willing Creatures or Objects Roughly the Size of a Creature

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT8LAlUeEJHgsR4h0_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (7th) Lorthact and the other targets can travel to any location within 1,000 miles.
Heightened (8th) Lorthact and the other targets can travel to any location on the same planet. If Lorthact travels more than 1,000 miles, he arrives only 10 miles off target.
Heightened (9th) Lorthact and the other targets can travel to any location on another planet within the same solar system. Assuming Lorthact has accurate knowledge of the location's position and appearance, he arrives on the new planet 100 miles off target.
Heightened (10th) As the 9th-level version, but Lorthact and the other targets can travel to any planet within the same galaxy.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT8LAlUeEJHgsR4h0_description
attribs.current: Lorthact and the targets are instantly transported to any location within range, as long as he can identify the location precisely both by its position relative to his starting position and by its appearance (or other identifying features). Incorrect knowledge of the location's appearance usually causes the spell to fail, but it could instead lead to teleporting to an unwanted location or some other unusual mishap determined by the GM. Teleport is not precise over great distances. The targets appear at a distance from the intended destination equal to roughly 1 percent of the total distance traveled, in a direction determined by the GM. For short journeys, this lack of precision is irrelevant, but for long distances this could be up to 1 mile.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT9ZQBMOOU1CNdDS4_target
attribs.current: 1 Spell Effect or Unattended Magic Item

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNT9ZQBMOOU1CNdDS4_description
attribs.current: Lorthact unravels the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. Counteracting a Magic Item causes it to become mundane for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artefact or similar item, Lorthact automatically fails.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNTAiDs6h-Sl8rlCtE_description
attribs.current:
Lorthact transports the target into an extradimensional maze of eldritch origin and trap it there. Once each turn, the target can spend 1 action to attempt a Survival check or Perception check against Lorthact's spell DC to escape the maze.
Teleportation magic doesn't help the creature escape unless the magic can transport across planes, such as plane shift. When the spell ends, either because the target escaped or the duration ran out, the target returns to the space it occupied when it was banished, or to the nearest space if the original is now filled.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNTAiDs6h-Sl8rlCtE_save_failure
attribs.current: The target makes no progress toward escape.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNTAiDs6h-Sl8rlCtE_save_success
attribs.current: The target is on the right path to the exit. If the target was already on the right path, it escapes the maze and the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNTAiDs6h-Sl8rlCtE_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target makes no progress toward escape, and if it was on the right path, it no longer is.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNTAiDs6h-Sl8rlCtE_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target escapes and the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNTBZuiVJZ9juJKGt1_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (8th) Lorthact can target up to 10 creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNTBZuiVJZ9juJKGt1_description
attribs.current: Lorthact's honeyed words are difficult for creatures to resist. Lorthact suggests a course of action to the target, which must be phrased in such a way as to seem like a logical course of action to the target and can't be selfdestructive or obviously against the target's self-interest. The target must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNTBZuiVJZ9juJKGt1_save_failure
attribs.current: The target immediately follows Lorthact's suggestion. The spell has a duration of 1 minute, or until the target has completed a finite suggestion or the suggestion becomes self-destructive or has other obvious negative effects.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNTBZuiVJZ9juJKGt1_save_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and thinks Lorthact was talking to them normally, not casting a spell on them.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNTBZuiVJZ9juJKGt1_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: As failure, but the base duration is 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBNTBZuiVJZ9juJKGt1_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and knows Lorthact tried to control it.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTDUfKdJsuMT03T0H_description
attribs.current: A ray with the power to sap a foe's strength flashes from Lorthact's hand. Attempt a ranged spell attack against the target. If Lorthact succeeds, that creature attempts a Fortitude save in order to determine the spell's effect. If Lorthact critically succeeds on his attack roll, use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of its save.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTEv0iyNjuNdcZhTy_description
attribs.current:
Three illusory images of Lorthact swirls about his space, potentially causing those who attack him to hit one of the images instead of him. Any attack that would hit Lorthact has a random chance of hitting one of his images instead of him. If all three images remain, there is a 1 in 4 chance of hitting Lorthact (1 on 1d4). With two images remaining, there is a 1 in 3 chance of hitting Lorthact (12 on 1d6). With only one image, the chances are 1 in 2 (13 on 1d6).
Once an image is hit, it is destroyed. If an attack roll fails to hit Lorthact's AC but doesn't critically fail, it destroys an image but has no additional effect (even if the attack would normally have an effect on a failure). If an attack roll is a critical success and would hit one of the images, one of the images is destroyed and the attack roll becomes a success against Lorthact. Once all the images are destroyed, the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTGKd8gQxaogcEH6O_duration
attribs.current: 1 Round or Sustained Up to 1 Minute

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTGKd8gQxaogcEH6O_description
attribs.current: With a cursory mental touch, Lorthact attempts to read the target's mind. It must attempt a Will save. The target then becomes temporarily immune to Lorthact's mind reading for 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTGKd8gQxaogcEH6O_save_failure
attribs.current: Lorthact perceives vague surface thoughts from the target when he Cast the Spell, and he finds out whether its Intelligence modifier is higher than, equal to, or lower than his.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTGKd8gQxaogcEH6O_save_success
attribs.current: Lorthact finds out whether the target's Intelligence modifier is higher than, equal to, or lower than yours.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTGKd8gQxaogcEH6O_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: As failure, and for the duration of the spell, Lorthact can Sustain the Spell to detect the target's surface thoughts again. The target doesn't receive any additional saves.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTGKd8gQxaogcEH6O_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target perceives vague surface thoughts from Lorthact when he Cast the Spell.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTHjKnYZLnhmkw2pm_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (4th) The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTHjKnYZLnhmkw2pm_description
attribs.current: Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes invisible. This makes it undetected to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it hidden to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTJDMZ4e-uNyMiymp_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+2) Lorthact shoots one additional missile with each action he spends.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTJDMZ4e-uNyMiymp_description
attribs.current: Lorthact sends a dart of force streaking toward a creature that he can see. It automatically hits and deals 1d4+1 force damage. For each additional action Lorthact uses when Casting the Spell, increase the number of missiles he shoots by one, to a maximum of three missiles for 3 actions. Lorthact chooses the target for each missile individually. If Lorthact shoots more than one missile at the same target, combine the damage before applying bonuses or penalties to damage, resistances, weaknesses, and so forth.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTKkogOYZV3eVbjay_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+1) The damage increases by 2d6 on a failure and by 3d6 on a critical failure.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTKkogOYZV3eVbjay_description
attribs.current: Lorthact creates a phantasmal image of the most fearsome creature imaginable to the target. Only the spell's target can see the killer, though Lorthact can see the vague shape of the illusion as it races forth to attack. The effect of the killer is based on the outcome of the target's Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTKkogOYZV3eVbjay_save_failure
attribs.current: The target takes 8d6 mental damage and is frightened 2.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTKkogOYZV3eVbjay_save_success
attribs.current: The target takes 4d6 mental damage and is frightened 1.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTKkogOYZV3eVbjay_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target is so afraid it might die. It must attempt a Fortitude save; if the target fails, it dies. On a successful Fortitude save, the target takes 12d6 mental damage, is fleeing until the end of its next turn, and is frightened 4. This effect has the incapacitation trait.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTLrdGoVmczX5-pJf_description
attribs.current: Lorthact shapes the quasi-real substance of the Shadow Plane into a blast. Choose acid, bludgeoning, cold, electricity, fire, force, piercing, slashing, or sonic damage, and choose a 30-foot cone, a 15-foot burst within 120 feet, or a 50-foot line. The blast deals 5d8 damage of the type Lorthact chose to each creature in the area.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBNTMzbt9kkYrFrZZGc_description
attribs.current: Lorthact pulls the moisture from the targets' bodies, dealing 10d10 negative damage. Creatures made of water (such as water elementals) and plant creatures use the outcome for one degree of success worse than the result of their saving throw. Creatures whose bodies contain no significant moisture (such as earth elementals) are immune to horrid wilting.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NBUQnv1r57owsoZYvoo_description
attribs.current: As a side effect of existing slightly outside the normal time stream, Lorthact is difficult to detect via divination spells and abilities. These effects function as though Lorthact and items he carries are not present, and those specifically targeting him, such as scrying, fail entirely unless the source of the divination is a higher level than Lorthactin which case they succeed only if the caster succeeds at a DC 16 secret flat check.

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-NBI76104EKEISRH6pz0_description
attribs.current:
30 feet. The Erinyes Company agent bolsters lowerlevel guards under their command, granting them a +1 status bonus to their attack rolls and a +2 status bonus to their Will saves. 
A monsters aura automatically affects everything within a specified emanation around that monster. The monster doesnt need to spend actions on the aura; rather, the auras effects are applied at specific times, such as when a creature ends its turn in the aura or when creatures enter the aura. If an aura does nothing but deal damage, its entry lists only the radius, damage, and saving throw. Such auras deal this damage to a creature when the creature enters the aura and when a creature starts its turn in the aura. A creature can take damage from the aura only once per round. The GM might determine that a monsters aura doesnt affect its own allies. For example, a creature might be immune to a monster frightful presence if they have been around each other for a long time.

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-NBI76104EKEISRH6pz1_description
attribs.current: When the Erinyes Company agent rolls a success on a Will save against a fear effect, they get a critical success instead. In addition, any time they gain the frightened condition, reduce its value by 1.

attribs.name: repeating_interaction-abilities_-NBI76104EKEISRH6pz2_description
attribs.current: When the Erinyes Company agent has their shield raised, they can Shield Block when an attack is made against an adjacent ally. If they do, the shield prevents that ally from taking damage instead of the agent.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NBI76104EKEISRH6pz3_trigger
attribs.current: A creature within the the Erinyes Company agent reach uses a manipulate action or a move action, makes a ranged attack, or leaves a square during a move action its using.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NBI76104EKEISRH6pz3_description
attribs.current: Effect: The Erinyes Company agent attempts a melee Strike against the triggering creature. If the attack is a critical hit and the trigger was a manipulate action, the agent disrupts that action. This Strike doesnt count toward the agent's multiple attack penalty, and its multiple attack penalty doesnt apply to this Strike.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NBI7611m2RmulV-4Mwp_trigger
attribs.current: The Erinyes Company agent has its shield raised and takes damage from a physical attack.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NBI7611m2RmulV-4Mwp_description
attribs.current: Effect: The Erinyes Company agent snaps its shield into place to deflect a blow. The shield prevents the agent from taking an amount of damage up to the shields Hardness. The agent and the shield each take any remaining damage, possibly breaking or destroying the shield.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBI7611m2RmulV-4Mws_description
attribs.current: Requirements: The Erinyes Company agent has their shield raised; Effect: The Erinyes Company agent presses forward, using their shield to push back foes. The agent Strides and Shoves, in either order. The multiple attack penalty doesnt apply to this Shove, though the Shove does count toward the agent's multiple attack penalty.
