attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBI8ZPLSLgtjKsJonim_description
attribs.current: When the priest casts heal, they roll d10s instead of d8s.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBI8ZPLSLgtjKsJonin_description
attribs.current: If another creatures reaction would disrupt the priests spellcasting action, the priest attempts a DC 15 flat check. If the priest succeeds, their action isnt disrupted.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBI8ZPLSLgtjKsJonio_description
attribs.current: DC 24, attack +16; 3rd circle of protection, heal (x3), searing light (x2); 2nd gentle repose, silence, spiritual weapon; 1st disrupting weapons, mindlink, spirit link; Cantrips (3rd) detect magic, disrupt undead, light, read aura, shield

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-NBI8ZPLSLgtjKsJonir_description
attribs.current: Seeing another pass from this world to the next invigorates a priest of Pharasma. The priest gains temporary Hit Points equal to the triggering creature's level plus their wisdom modifier. If the triggering creature was undead, double the number of temporary Hit Points the priest gains. These last for the duration of the spell, and the spell ends if all the temporary Hit Points are depleted earlier.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bI_description
attribs.current:
A priest of Pharasma sends out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. The priest receives no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. The priest can choose to ignore magic they're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of them and their allies.
The priest detects illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the level of their detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bJ_description
attribs.current: A priest of Pharasma lances the target with energy. The priest deals 1d6 positive damage plus their wisdom modifier. The target must attempt a basic Fortitude save. If the creature critically fails the save, it is also enfeebled 1 for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bK_description
attribs.current: The object glows, casting bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light for the next 20 feet) like a torch. If a priest of Pharasma casts this spell again on a second object, the light spell on the first object ends.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bL_description
attribs.current:
A priest of Pharasma focuses on the target object, opening their mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, the priest knows whether that item is magical, and if it is, they learn the school of magic.
If the object is illusory, the priest detects this only if the effect's level is lower than the level of their read aura spell.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bM_description
attribs.current:
A priest of Pharasma raises a magical shield of force. This counts as using the Raise a Shield action, giving the priest a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of their next turn, but it doesn't require a hand to use.
While the spell is in effect, the priest can use the Shield Block reaction with their magic shield (see the sidebar). The shield has Hardness 5. After the priest uses Shield Block, the spell ends and they can't cast it again for 10 minutes. Unlike a normal Shield Block, the priest can use the spell's reaction against the magic missile spell.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bN_description
attribs.current: A priest of Pharasma wards a creature and those nearby against a specified alignment. Choose chaotic, evil, good, or lawful; this spell gains the opposing trait. Creatures in the area gain a +1 status bonus to AC against attacks by creatures of the chosen alignment and to saves against effects from such creatures. This bonus increases to +3 against effects from such creatures that directly control the target and attacks made by summoned creatures of the chosen alignment. Summoned creatures of the chosen alignment can't willingly enter the area without succeeding at a Will save; repeated attempts use the first save result.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bO_description
attribs.current:
A priest of Pharasma channels positive energy to heal the living or damage the undead. If the target is a willing living creature, the priest restores 1d8 Hit Points. If the target is undead, the priest deals that amount of positive damage to it, and it gets a basic Fortitude save. The number of actions the priest spends when Casting this Spell determines its targets, range, area, and other parameters.
[one-action] (somatic) The spell has a range of touch.
[two-actions] (somatic, verbal) The spell has a range of 30 feet. If the priest's healing a living creature, increase the Hit Points restored by 8.
[three-actions] (material, somatic, verbal) The priest disperses positive energy in a 30-foot emanation. This targets all living and undead creatures in the burst.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bP_description
attribs.current:
A priest of Pharasma shoots a blazing ray of light tinged with holy energy. Make a ranged spell attack. The ray deals 5d6 fire damage. If the target is a fiend or undead, the priest deals an extra 5d6 good damage.
If the light passes through an area of magical darkness or targets a creature affected by magical darkness, searing light attempts to counteract the darkness. If the priest needs to determine whether the light passes through an area of darkness, draw a line between themself and the spell's target.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bQ_description
attribs.current: The targeted corpse doesn't decay, nor can it be transformed into an undead. If the corpse is subject to a spell that requires the corpse to have died within a certain amount of time (for example, raise dead), do not count the duration of gentle repose against that time. This spell also prevents ordinary bugs and pests (such as maggots) from consuming the body.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bR_description
attribs.current: The target makes no sound, preventing creatures from noticing it using hearing or other senses alone. The target can't use sonic attacks, nor can it use actions with the auditory trait. This prevents it from casting spells that include verbal components.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bS_description
attribs.current:
A weapon made of pure magical force materializes and attacks foes you designate within range. This weapon has a ghostly appearance and manifests as a club, knife, or Pharasma's favoured weapon.
When you cast the spell, the weapon appears next to a foe you choose within range and makes a Strike against it. Each time you Sustain the Spell, you can move the weapon to a new target within range (if needed) and Strike with it. The spiritual weapon uses and contributes to your multiple attack penalty.
The weapon's Strikes are melee spell attacks. Regardless of its appearance, the weapon deals force damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier. You can deal damage of the type normally dealt by the weapon instead of force damage (or any of the available damage types for a versatile weapon). No other statistics or traits of the weapon apply, and even a ranged weapon attacks adjacent creatures only. Despite making a spell attack, the spiritual weapon is a weapon for purposes of triggers, resistances, and so forth.
The weapon doesn't take up space, grant flanking, or have any other attributes a creature would. The weapon can't make any attack other than its Strike, and feats or spells that affect weapons do not apply to it.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bT_description
attribs.current: A priest of Pharasma infuses weapons with positive energy. Attacks with these weapons deal an extra 1d4 positive damage to undead.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bU_description
attribs.current: A priest of Pharasma links their mind to the target's mind and mentally impart to that target an amount of information in an instant that could otherwise be communicated in 10 minutes.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bV_description
attribs.current:
A priest of Pharasma forms a spiritual link with another creature, allowing them to take in its pain. When the priest Cast this Spell and at the start of each of their turns, if the target is below maximum Hit Points, it regains 2 Hit Points (or the difference between its current and maximum Hit Points, if that's lower). The priest loses as many Hit Points as the target regained. 
This is a spiritual transfer, so no effects apply that would increase the Hit Points the target regains or decrease the Hit Points the priest loses. This transfer also ignores any temporary Hit Points the priest or the target have. Since this effect doesn't involve positive or negative energy, spirit link works even if the priest or the target is undead. While the duration persists, the priest gains no benefit from regeneration or fast healing. The priest can Dismiss this spell, and if they'r ever at 0 Hit Points, spirit link ends automatically.

attribs.name: repeating_spellfocus_-NBI8ZPLSLgtjKsJonir_cast_detail_information
attribs.current: A Living Creature within 20 feet of the Pirest Dies, or an Undead Creature within 20 feet of them is Destroyed.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bI_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) A priest of Pharasma learns the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which the priest learn.
Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but a priest of Pharasma also pinpoints the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, the priest doesn't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bJ_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: If the creature critically fails the save, it is also enfeebled 1 for 1 round.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bK_target
attribs.current: 1 Object of 1 Bulk or Less, Either Unattended or Possessed by the Priest or a Willing Ally

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bK_duration
attribs.current: Until the Next Time the Priest Make Their Daily Preparations

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bK_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (4th) The object sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius (and dim light for the next 60 feet).

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bL_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) A priest of Pharasma can target up to 10 objects.
Heightened (6th) A priest of Pharasma can target any number of objects.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bM_duration
attribs.current: Until the Start of the Priest's Next Turn

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bM_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightening the spell increases the shield's Hardness.
Heightened (3rd) The shield has Hardness 10.
Heightened (5th) The shield has Hardness 15.
Heightened (7th) The shield has Hardness 20.
Heightened (9th) The shield has Hardness 25.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bN_area
attribs.current: 10-foot Emanation Centred on the Touched Creature

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bN_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (4th) The duration increases to 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bO_target
attribs.current: 1 Willing Living Creature or 1 Undead Creature

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bO_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+1) The amount of healing or damage increases by 1d8, and the extra healing for the 2-action version increases by 8.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bP_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+1) The fire damage increases by 2d6, and the good damage against fiends and undead increases by 2d6.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bP_damage_additional
attribs.current: Additonal [[5d6]] Good Damage (if Target is Fiend or Undead)

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bP_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target takes double fire damage, as well as double good damage if a fiend or undead.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bQ_duration
attribs.current: Until the Next Time the Priest Makes Their Daily Preparations

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bQ_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (5th) The spell's duration is unlimited, but the spell takes one more action to cast and requires a material component and a cost (embalming fluid worth 6 gp).

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bR_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (4th) The spell effect emanates from the touched creature, silencing all sound in or passing through a 10-foot radius and preventing any auditory and sonic effects in the affected area. While within the radius, creatures are subject to the same effects as the target. Depending upon the position of the effect, a creature might notice the lack of sound reaching it (blocking off the noise coming from a party, for example).

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bS_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+2) The weapon's damage increases by 1d8.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bT_target
attribs.current: Up to Two Weapons, Each of Which Must be Wielded by You or a Willing Ally, or Else Unattended

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bT_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) The damage increases to 2d4 damage.
Heightened (5th) Target up to three weapons, and the damage increases to 3d4 damage.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ZPM-XttC-dvZ8bV_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (+1) The number of Hit Points transferred each time increases by 2.

attribs.current:
{"size":"Medium","Token":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/files.d20.io/images/93324656/kYZv-hdcqNMZbblypMm4yg/original.png","level":"10","speed":"35","senses":"darkvision","traits":"Fiend, Rakshasa","stealth":"20","Category":"Monsters","npc_type":"Creature","spell_dc":"31","Expansion":"4137","alignment":"LE","data-List":"false","deception":"23","diplomacy":"21","languages":"Common, Infernal, Undercommon","occultism":"18","data-items":"[{"item":"+1 striking kukri"}]","data-spell":"[{"name":"dispel magic","spelllevel":"5","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"},{"name":"hallucination","spelllevel":"5","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"},{"name":"shadow blast","spelllevel":"5","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"},{"name":"clairvoyance","spelllevel":"4","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"},{"name":"dispel magic","spelllevel":"4","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"},{"name":"fly","spelllevel":"4","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"},{"name":"suggestion","spelllevel":"4","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"},{"name":"clairaudience","spelllevel":"3","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"},{"name":"dispel magic","spelllevel":"3","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"},{"name":"nondetection","spelllevel":"3","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"},{"name":"vampiric touch","spelllevel":"3","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"},{"name":"blur","spelllevel":"2","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"},{"name":"hideous laughter","spelllevel":"2","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"},{"name":"invisibility","spelllevel":"2","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"},{"name":"charm","spelllevel":"1","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"},{"name":"illusory object","spelllevel":"1","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"},{"name":"item facade","spelllevel":"1","type":"occult","frequency":"x/day"}]","perception":"19","weaknesses":"good 10","armor_class":"30","description":"When not disguised as a humanoid, the raja rakshasa has the head of an animal. The hands of a raja rakshasa are more subtly unsettling, for the fingers of these fiends bend outward, away from the palms.
More than any other types of rakshasa, rajas scoff at religion. They understand the power of the divine, yet they view themselves as the only things worthy of worship from mortal creatures; not even their own immortals are deemed deserving of such glorification. Raja rakshasas often form close-knit families that work together to bring down mortal cities or to rule them from the shadows within. Such families of rakshasas often incorporate other breeds of the fiend, often using dandasukas as favored servants or stealthy spies. Even though a raja family works together to achieve a shared goal, infighting and treachery among their own is a constant threat.

Raja Heads
Raja's heads often resemble those of cats or snakes, but they can also be similar to apes, jackals, vultures, elephants, mantises, lizards, rhinos, boars, and more are possible. In most cases, the type of head a raja rakshasa possesses symbolizes its personalitya tiger-headed one is stealthy and ravenous, while a boar-headed one might be gluttonous and crude.


Rakshasas are evil spirits that cloak themselves in the guises of humanoid creatures, that they might walk unseen among their prey. They embody what is taboo among most societies, and in the shape of those they seek to defile, rakshasas gorge themselves on these hideous acts. A wide range of rakshasas exist; presented below are the diminutive, sinister dandasuka rakshasa and the infamous raja rakshasa, who are the most widespread and commonly encountered of these fiends. 

Rakshasa Immortals
Above all rakshasas rule the rakshasa immortals, powerful unique entities who deem themselves deities. These beings include Aksha of the Second Breath, Bundha the Singing Butcher, Dradjit the Godslayer,
Kunkarna the Dream Warrior, Mursha the Beastmaster, Otikaya the Spirit Archer, Surpa the Avenger,
Zabha the Desecrator, and untold others.

This doesnt change the raja rakshasas Speed or its attack and damage modifiers with its Strikes but might change the damage type its Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning). It typically loses its fangs Strike unless the humanoid form has fangs or a similar unarmed attack.  \nThe monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monsters transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesnt gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block."},{"name":"Disturbing Vision ","actions":"1","traits":"concentrate, enchantment, mental, occult","description":"The raja rakshasas eyes flash green as it projects a telepathic wave in a 30-foot emanation. All creatures in the area are assailed by a vision of evil decadence from one of the rakshasas past lives. The visions last [[1d4]] (1d4) rounds, and while they do, the raja rakshasa and all evil creatures in the area gain a +1 status bonus to all checks. attribs.name: saving_throws_notes
attribs.current: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic, +3 Status to All Saves vs. Divine Magic

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVb_trigger
attribs.current: A creature within 30 feet casts a divine spell or uses a divine ability.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVb_description
attribs.current: Requirements: The raja rakshasa has an unexpended spell slot that can be used to cast dispel magic. Effect: The raja rakshasa expends a spell slot that could be used to cast dispel magic and attempts to counteract the triggering spell or ability. The raja rakshasa cant Scoff at the Divine for [[1d4]] (1d4) rounds.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVf_description
attribs.current:
The raja rakshasa takes on the appearance of any Medium humanoid. This doesnt change the raja rakshasas Speed or its attack and damage modifiers with its Strikes but might change the damage type its Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning). It typically loses its fangs Strike unless the humanoid form has fangs or a similar unarmed attack.  
The monster changes its shape indefinitely. It can use this action again to return to its natural shape or adopt a new shape. Unless otherwise noted, a monster cannot use Change Shape to appear as a specific individual. Using Change Shape counts as creating a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception. The monsters transformation automatically defeats Perception DCs to determine whether the creature is a member of the ancestry or creature type into which it transformed, and it gains a +4 status bonus to its Deception DC to prevent others from seeing through its disguise. Change Shape abilities specify what shapes the monster can adopt. The monster doesnt gain any special abilities of the new shape, only its physical form. For example, in each shape, it replaces its normal Speeds and Strikes, and might potentially change its senses or size. Any changes are listed in its stat block.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVg_description
attribs.current: The raja rakshasas eyes flash green as it projects a telepathic wave in a 30-foot emanation. All creatures in the area are assailed by a vision of evil decadence from one of the rakshasas past lives. Each non-evil creature in the area must succeed at a DC 31 Will save or become sickened 1 (and stunned 1 on a critical failure). The visions last [[1d4]] (1d4) rounds, and while they do, the raja rakshasa and all evil creatures in the area gain a +1 status bonus to all checks. The raja rakshasa can use this ability again only once the previous visions end.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVh_description
attribs.current: DC 33; 5th (3 slots) dispel magic, hallucination, shadow blast; 4th (4 slots) clairvoyance, dispel magic, fly, suggestion; 3rd (4 slots) clairaudience, dispel magic, nondetection, vampiric touch; 2nd (4 slots) blur, hideous laughter, invisibility; 1st (4 slots) charm, illusory object, item facade; Cantrips (5th) detect magic, ghost sound, mage hand, read aura, sigil

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVj_description
attribs.current: With a cursory mental touch, a raja rakshasa attempts to read the target's mind. It must attempt a Will save. The target then becomes temporarily immune to the raja rakshasa's mind reading for 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVk_description
attribs.current:
A raja rakshasa sends out a pulse that registers the presence of magic. The raja rakshasa receives no information beyond the presence or absence of magic. The raja rakshasa can choose to ignore magic they're fully aware of, such as the magic items and ongoing spells of them and their allies.
The raja rakshasa detect illusion magic only if that magic's effect has a lower level than the level of their detect magic spell. However, items that have an illusion aura but aren't deceptive in appearance (such as an invisibility potion) typically are detected normally.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVl_description
attribs.current: A raja rakshasa creates an auditory illusion of simple sounds that has a maximum volume equal to four normal humans shouting. The sounds emanate from a square the raja rakshasa designates within range. The raja rakshasa can't create intelligible words or other intricate sounds (such as music).

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVm_description
attribs.current: A raja rakshasa creates a single magical hand, either invisible or ghostlike, that grasps the target object and moves it slowly up to 20 feet. Because the raja rakshasa's levitating the object, they can move it in any direction. When the raja rakshasa Sustain the Spell, they can move the object an additional 20 feet. If the object is in the air when the spell ends, the object falls.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVn_description
attribs.current:
A raja rakshasa focuses on the target object, opening their mind to perceive magical auras. When the casting is complete, the raja rakshasa knows whether that item is magical, and if it is, they learn the school of magic.
If the object is illusory, the raja rakshasa detects this only if the effect's level is lower than the level of their read aura spell.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVo_description
attribs.current: A raja rakshasa harmlessly places their unique magical sigil, which is about 1 square inch in size, on the targeted creature or object. The mark can be visible or invisible, and the raja rakshasa can change it from one state to another by using an Interact action to touch the target. The mark can be scrubbed or scraped off with 5 minutes of work. If it's on a creature, it fades naturally over the course of a week. The time before the mark fades increases depending on the raja rakshasa's heightened level.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVp_description
attribs.current: A raja rakshasa unravels the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. Counteracting a Magic Item causes it to become mundane for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artifact or similar item, the raja rakshasa automatically fails.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVq_description
attribs.current:
The target consistently detects one thing as another, can't detect something that's there, or detects something that's not there, though it doesn't alter their beliefs. The raja rakshasa chooses which of these effects applies, and they determine the specifics of the hallucination. For example, the raja rakshasa could make the target see all elves as humans, be unable to detect the presence of their brother, see their beloved pocket watch on their person even when it isn't, or see a tower in the centre of town.
The target can attempt an initial Will save, with effects below. They also receive a Will save to disbelieve the hallucination every time they Seek or directly interact with the hallucination. For example, the target could attempt to disbelieve the hallucination each time they interacted with an elf, bumped into their brother accidentally, tried to check their pocket watch, or studied the tower. The target can attempt to disbelieve with a large circumstance bonus in situations determined by the GM, such as if the target attempted to climb the nonexistent tower.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVr_description
attribs.current: A raja rakshasa shapes the quasi-real substance of the Shadow Plane into a blast. Choose acid, bludgeoning, cold, electricity, fire, force, piercing, slashing, or sonic damage, and choose a 30-foot cone, a 15-foot burst within 120 feet, or a 50-foot line. The blast deals 5d8 damage of the type the raja rakshasa chose to each creature in the area.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVs_description
attribs.current: A raja rakshasa creates an invisible floating eye at a location within range (even if it's outside their line of sight or line of effect). The eye can't move, but the raja rakshasa can see in all directions from that point as if using their normal visual senses.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVt_description
attribs.current: A raja rakshasa unravels the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. Counteracting a Magic Item causes it to become mundane for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artifact or similar item, the raja rakshasa automatically fails.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVu_description
attribs.current: The target can soar through the air, gaining a fly Speed equal to its Speed or 20 feet, whichever is greater.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVv_description
attribs.current: A raja rakshasa's honeyed words are difficult for creatures to resist. The raja rakshasa suggests a course of action to the target, which must be phrased in such a way as to seem like a logical course of action to the target and can't be selfdestructive or obviously against the target's self-interest. The target must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVw_description
attribs.current: A raja rakshasa creates an invisible floating ear at a location within range (even if it's outside their line of sight or line of effect). It can't move, but the raja rakshasa can hear through the ear as if using their normal auditory senses.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVx_description
attribs.current: A raja rakshasa unravels the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. Counteracting a Magic Item causes it to become mundane for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artifact or similar item, the raja rakshasa automatically fails.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVy_description
attribs.current: A raja rakshasa erects protective wards that make the target difficult to detect via magic. Nondetection attempts to counteract all detection, revelation, and scrying divinations made against the target or the target's gear throughout the duration, counting cantrips as 1st-level spells for this purpose. Successfully counteracting a divination that targets an area or multiple targets negates the effects only for nondetection's target.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVz_description
attribs.current: A raja rakshasa's touch leeches the lifeblood out of a target to empower themself. The raja rakshasa deals 6d6 negative damage to the target. The raja rakshasa gains temporary Hit Points equal to half the negative damage the target takes (after applying resistances and the like). The raja rakshasa loses any remaining temporary Hit Points after 1 minute.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJu_description
attribs.current: The target 's form appears blurry. It becomes concealed. As the nature of this effect still leaves the target 's location obvious, the target can 't use this concealment to Hide or Sneak.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJv_description
attribs.current: The target is overtaken with uncontrollable laughter. It must attempt a Will save.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJw_description
attribs.current: Cloaked in illusion, the target becomes invisible. This makes it undetected to all creatures, though the creatures can attempt to find the target, making it hidden to them instead. If the target uses a hostile action, the spell ends after that hostile action is completed.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJx_description
attribs.current:
To the target, the raja rakshasa's words are honey and their visage seems bathed in a dreamy haze. It must attempt a Will save, with a +4 circumstance bonus if the raja rakshasa or their allies recently threatened it or used hostile actions against it. 
The raja rakshasa can Dismiss the spell. If the raja rakshasa uses hostile actions against the target, the spell ends. When the spell ends, the target doesn 't necessarily realize it was charmed unless its friendship with the raja rakshasa or the actions theirs convinced it to take clash with its expectations, meaning they could potentially convince the target to continue being their friend via mundane means.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJy_description
attribs.current:
A raja rakshasa creates an illusory visual image of a stationary object. The entire image must fit within the spell's area. The object appears to animate naturally, but it doesn't make sounds or generate smells. For example, water would appear to pour down an illusory waterfall, but it would be silent.
Any creature that touches the image or uses the Seek action to examine it can attempt to disbelieve the raja rakshasa's illusion.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJz_description
attribs.current: A raja rakshasa makes the target object look and feel as though it were in much better or worse physical condition. When the raja rakshasa casts this spell, decide whether they want to make the object look decrepit or perfect. An item made to look decrepit appears broken and shoddy. An intact item made to look better appears as though it's brand new and highly polished or well maintained. A broken item appears to be intact and functional. Destroyed items can't be affected by this spell. A creature that Interacts with the item can attempt to disbelieve the illusion.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVj_duration
attribs.current: 1 Round or Sustained up to 1 Minute

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVj_save_failure
attribs.current: The raja rakshasa perceives vague surface thoughts from the target when they Cast the Spell, and they find out whether its Intelligence modifier is higher than, equal to, or lower than theirs.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVj_save_success
attribs.current: The raja rakshasa finds out whether the target's Intelligence modifier is higher than, equal to, or lower than theirs.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVj_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: As failure, and for the duration of the spell, the raja rakshasa can Sustain the Spell to detect the target's surface thoughts again. The target doesn't receive any additional saves.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVj_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target perceives vague surface thoughts from raja rakshasa when they Cast the Spell.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVk_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) A raja rakshasa learns the school of magic for the highest-level effect within range that the spell detects. If multiple effects are equally strong, the GM determines which the raja rakshasa learns.
Heightened (4th) As 3rd level, but a raja rakshasa also pinpoints the source of the highest-level magic. Like for an imprecise sense, the raja rakshasa doesn't learn the exact location, but can narrow down the source to within a 5-foot cube (or the nearest if larger than that).

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVl_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) The range increases to 60 feet.
Heightened (5th) The range increases to 120 feet.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVm_target
attribs.current: 1 Unattended Object of 1 Bulk or Less

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVm_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) A raja rakshasa can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.
Heightened (5th) The range increases to 60 feet, and you can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 1 or less.
Heightened (7th) The range increases to 60 feet, and a raja rakshasa can target an unattended object with a Bulk of 2 or less.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVn_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) A raja rakshasa can target up to 10 objects.
Heightened (6th) A raja rakshasa can target any number of objects.

attribs.name: repeating_cantrip_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVo_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (3rd) The sigil instead fades after 1 month.
Heightened (5th) The sigil instead fades after 1 year.
Heightened (7th) The sigil never fades.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVp_target
attribs.current: 1 Spell Effect or Unattended Magic Item

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVq_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (6th) Choose to either target up to 10 creatures or change the spell's duration to until the next time you make your daily preparations.
Heightened (8th) Choose to either target any number of creatures or change the spell's duration to unlimited.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVq_save_failure
attribs.current: The creature perceives what the raja rakshasa chose until it disbelieves.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVq_save_success
attribs.current: The creature perceives what the raja rakshasa chose until it disbelieves, but it knows what the hallucination is.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVq_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The creature perceives what the raja rakshasa chose until it disbelieves, and it trusts its false senses, taking a 4 circumstance penalty to saves to disbelieve.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVt_target
attribs.current: 1 Spell Effect or Unattended Magic Item

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVu_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (7th) The duration increases to 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVv_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (8th) A raja rakshasa can target up to 10 creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVv_save_failure
attribs.current: The target immediately follows the raja rakshasa's suggestion. The spell has a duration of 1 minute, or until the target has completed a finite suggestion or the suggestion becomes self-destructive or has other obvious negative effects.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVv_save_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and thinks the raja rakshasa was talking to them normally, not casting a spell on them.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVv_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: As failure, but the base duration is 1 hour.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVv_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and knows the raja rakshasa tried to control it.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljZVOEOdSONLfVx_target
attribs.current: 1 Spell Effect or Unattended Magic Item

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJv_save_failure
attribs.current: The target is slowed 1 and can't use reactions.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJv_save_success
attribs.current: The target is plagued with uncontrollable laugher. It can't use reactions.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJv_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target falls prone and can't use actions or reactions for 1 round. It then suffers the failure effects.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJw_heightened
attribs.current: Heightened (4th) The spell lasts 1 minute, but it doesn't end if the target uses a hostile action.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJx_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (4th) The duration lasts until the next time the raja rakshasa makes their daily preparations.
Heightened (8th) The duration lasts until the next time the raja rakshasa make their daily preparations, and they can target up to 10 creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJx_save_failure
attribs.current: The target 's attitude becomes friendly toward the raja rakshasa. If it was friendly, it becomes helpful. It can 't use hostile actions against the raja rakshasa.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJx_save_success
attribs.current: Success The target is unaffected but thinks the raja rakshasa's spell was something harmless instead of charm, unless it identifies the spell (usually by using Identifying Magic, see Identifying Spells).

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJx_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The target 's attitude becomes helpful toward the raja rakshasa, and it can 't use hostile actions against them.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJx_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The target is unaffected and aware the raja rakshasa tried to charm it.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJy_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (2nd) A raja rakshasa's image makes appropriate sounds, generates normal smells, and feels right to the touch. The spell gains the auditory and olfactory traits. The duration increases to 1 hour.
Heightened (5th) As the 2nd-level version, but the duration is unlimited.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJz_target
attribs.current: 1 Object No More than 10 feet by 10 feet by 10 feet

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBI8ljaZFQ6d5JhXiJz_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (2nd) The duration is 24 hours.
Heightened (3rd) The duration is unlimited.

attribs.name: hit_points_notes
attribs.current: Coffin Restoration, Fast Healing 10, Negative Healing

attribs.name: immunities
attribs.current: Death Effects, Disease, Paralyze, Poison, Sleep

attribs.name: resistances
attribs.current: All Physical 10 (Except Silver or Weapons Shedding Bright Light)

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBj1zG5OGvP4QKZ1lVZ_description
attribs.current: When drinking essence, the strigoi servant regains 13 HP.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBj26IzaqXd4tUTCsTA_description
attribs.current: The strigoi servant deals [[[1d6]] (1d6) extra precision damage to flat-footed creatures.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBj2J2eIa-j5Vf9-gY8_description
attribs.current: The strigoi servant defies gravity and levitate the target 5 feet off the ground. For the duration of the spell, strigoi servant can move the target up or down 10 feet with a single action, which has the concentrate trait. A creature floating in the air from levitate takes a 2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls. A floating creature can spend an Interact action to stabilize itself and negate this penalty for the remainder of its turn. If the target is adjacent to a fixed object or terrain of suitable stability, it can move across the surface by climbing (if the surface is vertical, like a wall) or crawling (if the surface is horizontal, such as a ceiling). The GM determines which surfaces can be climbed or crawled across.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NBlqGxQtJHIneN0V1oX_description
attribs.current: Abridan is an ex-cleric. While hes lost the magical abilities that come from his connection to Pharasma, he can still use the major staff of healing or any of his scrolls by tricking the item. Since he cant cast spells, he cant recharge his staff, and uses its remaining charges only as a last resort.

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NBlqL7BeTeO6cHTShNS_trigger
attribs.current: Abridan dies before hes had a chance to atone for his blasphemies or has become an actual cleric of Urgathoa;

attribs.name: repeating_free-actions-reactions_-NBlqL7BeTeO6cHTShNS_description
attribs.current: Effect Urgathoa watched Abridans fall from grace, and if he dies before he finishes his conversion, her disappointment causes his body to decay as if he had been dead for a week. This process also causes all living creatures within 30 feet to take [[11d6]] (11d6) negative damage (DC 33 basic Fortitude save). If steps are not thereafter taken to prevent his soul from returning (such as by casting gentle repose on the partially decayed corpse), Abridan rises as a dybbuk (Pathfinder Bestiary 3 88) on the site of his death a minute after the next sundown and seeks revenge on the PCs for killing him.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBlqu1CTpxDWkNSFOgD_description
attribs.current:
Abridan attempts to trick his staff or a scroll by attempting a Religion check against the items Trick DC listed above.
Success For the rest of his turn, Abridan can spend actions to activate the staff or scroll as if he could normally use it.
Failure Abridan cant use the item or try to trick it again this turn, but can try again on subsequent turns.
Critical Failure Abridan cant use the item, and cant try to trick it again until his next daily preparation at sunrise.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBlr4rrGTwfXQti3F5r_description
attribs.current:
Secondary Casters 2
Primary Check Religion (expert); Secondary Checks Occultism, Religion

Abridan calls upon gods, spirits, and stranger beings to bar a creatures spirit from ever returning. A spirit that doesnt wish to be so constrained can attempt a Will save to resist this ritual; on a critical success, it fools Abridan into believing the ritual succeeded. This ritual has no effect on a target who is undead or whose soul is otherwise not in the afterlife.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBlr4rrGTwfXQti3F5r_save_success
attribs.current: As critical success, but effects to interact with the spirit fail unless the effects counteract level is higher than that of rest eternal or originates from an artefact or a deity.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBlr4rrGTwfXQti3F5r_save_critical_failure
attribs.current: The ritual fails, and the spirits Abridan appealed to are angered by his meddling. All casters become doomed 1 for 1 week.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBlr4rrGTwfXQti3F5r_save_critical_success
attribs.current: Abridan sequesters the subjects spirit to the afterlife. Attempts to communicate with the dead creature, return it to life, turn it into an undead, or otherwise disturb its afterlife fail unless the effects counteract level is at least 2 higher than that of rest eternal or originates from an artefact or a deity. Successfully returning the creature to life ends the restrictions placed by rest eternal.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBlr3gk6fdoBk8QH-JX_description
attribs.current:
Secondary Casters 1
Primary Check Occultism (expert) or Religion (expert); Secondary Checks Occultism or Religion (whichever isn't used for the primary check)

Abridan tears the veil to the afterlife and call a Spirit from its final Resting place. Abridan must call the Spirit by name, and he must provide a connection to the Spirit, such as a Possession, a garment, or a piece of its corpse. A Spirit unwilling to heed Abridan's call can attempt a Will Save to avoid it; on a critical success, a Trickster Spirit Impersonates the Spirit he meant to call. The DC of the Will Save is 2 lower if Abridan hasn't met the Spirit In Life. Either way, the Spirit appears as a wispy form of the creature he meant to call. Each minute of the Duration, Abridan can ask the Spirit a question. It can answer how it pleases or even refuse to answer. If the Spirit isn't in the afterlife (such as if it's an undead), all results other than critical failures use the failure Effect.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBlr3gk6fdoBk8QH-JX_save_critical_success
attribs.current: The Spirit is particularly cooperative, and even if it has strong reasons to deceive Abridan, it takes a 2 circumstance penalty to its Deception checks.

attribs.name: repeating_normalspells_-NBlr3gk6fdoBk8QH-JX_save_failure
attribs.current: Abridan fails to call a Spirit.

{"size":"Huge","Token":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/files.d20.io/images/93314048/rnlWjqYjcD-e4qGrSGjtpQ/original.png","level":"13","speed":"35","senses":"darkvision, true seeing","traits":"Demon, Fiend","society":"22","stealth":"21","Category":"Monsters","npc_type":"Creature","religion":"22","spell_dc":"34","Expansion":"4137","alignment":"CE","data-List":"false","deception":"28","diplomacy":"26","languages":"Abyssal, Celestial, Draconic, telepathy 100 feet, tongues","perception":"24","weaknesses":"cold iron 10, good 10","armor_class":"34","description":"Glabrezus are looming behemoths who revel in the act of twisting mortal desires into their ultimate ruin, betraying and manipulating as easily as they breathe. Desires granted by a glabrezu always come to fruition in the most destructive way possible, turning a wish or hope into a potent and devastating act of betrayalalthough the long-term repercussions are not always immediately apparent. For example, a struggling weapon smith might wish for fame and skill at their craft, only to find that their best patron is a cruel and sadistic murderer who uses the weapons in bloody sprees. Or a lonely widower might have his desire granted in the form of a lost love returned to life as a vampire. Glabrezus are nothing if not creative in addressing a mortals needs.
These massive demons have enormous pincers and a pair of smaller humanoid arms sprouting from their chests, but their size belies their skill at magic, and they possess formidable innate spells. Treachery demons arise from the souls of mortals engaged in treason and deception.

When a sinful mortal soul is judged and sent on to the Abyss, it can become a deadly fienda demon. Demons are living incarnations of sinbe they classic sins like wrath or gluttony, or more specialized depravities like an obsession with torture or the act of treason or treachery. Once formed, a demons driving goals are twofoldthe amassing of personal power, and the corruption of mortal souls to cause them to become tainted by sin. In this way demons ensure a never-ending supply of new demons to bolster their ever-growing ranks in the Abyss.

Demonic Deities 
The most powerful demons are known as demon lords (the term is gender neutral in this case). Of these divinities, Lamashtu is the most powerful. Countless other demon lords exist, including Abraxas, Cyth-Vsug, Kabriri, and Zura.

The Nature of Chaos
Some say that the nature of chaos inherently precludes cooperation and subtlety, but demons are proof of the fallacy of this claim.

What Makes a Sin?
Some classify sin into seven categoriesenvy, gluttony, greed, lust, pride, sloth, and wrath. While these sins embody some of the most powerful and numerous demons, far more than seven demons exist. Any act of cruelty or destruction a mortal takes to gratify the self at others expense is, in effect, a sin, and any such act can spawn a demon from a soul in the afterlife.

Demonic Possession
Some demons specialize in the art of possessing creatures or objects to spread fear and chaos. In such cases a demon gains a powerful disguise with which to work its evils upon the world, a subterfuge that delights the demon.

Sinful Destruction
While they enjoy causing destruction themselves, most demons prefer to trick and tempt mortals into falling to sin of their own volition.

Demonic Locations
The sprawling, heaving, changing realm of the Abyss is the planar home of demonic life, but demons can be found anywhere the capacity to sin exists. Evil or foolish conjurers are fond of calling upon demons for advice or darker needs. When the Abyss wears through the boundaries of reality to create wound-like portals into other worlds, demons can spill over to wreak incredible havoc.

Demonic Sources
When a sinful mortal soul is consigned to the Abyss, it spends time wallowing in the mire and feeding on filth. If it survives and is not itself eaten, the soul eventually ascends into a demon, as influenced by the nature of its sin, yet most demons are themselves capable of reproduction as well. The fecundity of demonic life is perhaps the greatestand most threateningaspect of these dangerous fiends.

Other Demons
The Abyss may be the largest of the Outer Planes, and mortals have an equally large capacity to betray themselves, society, and the natural order of reality. With this limitless source for increasingly specialized sins, the Abyss is constantly generating new types of demons to plague reality. While the vast majority of these are swiftly destroyed and never rise again, enough survive that dozens, if not hundreds, of types of demons are known to exist beyond those listed here. The shadowy invidiak is a demon without a body, born of envious souls. The goat-faced, flame-hooved brimorak rises from the souls of arsonists. Slimy, horned blood demons spawn from assassins, boar demons from the greedy... the list goes on and on.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBI9VWTz0fmU0HIzaK1_description
attribs.current:
Tungort creates an illusion that causes it to appear as another creature of the same body shape, and with roughly similar height (within 6 inches) and weight (within 50 pounds), as itself. The disguise is typically good enough to hide Tungort's identity, but not to impersonate a specific individual. The spell doesn't change your voice, scent, or mannerisms. Tungort can change the appearance of your clothing and worn items, such as making its armour look like a dress. Held items are unaffected, and any worn item Tungort removes returns to its true appearance.
Casting illusory disguise counts as setting up a disguise for the Impersonate use of Deception; it ignores any circumstance penalties Tungort might take for disguising itself as a dissimilar creature, it gives it a +4 status bonus to Deception checks to prevent others from seeing through its disguise, and it adds its level even if it's untrained. Tungort can Dismiss this spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBI9VWTz0fmU0HIzaK2_description
attribs.current:
Tungort reverses gravity in the area. Creatures and objects that aren't secured to the ground immediately fall upward to the top of the area. A creature might be able to Grab an Edge to arrest its fall if it falls past an appropriate surface. If a creature falls against a solid object (such as a ceiling), it takes the appropriate amount of falling damage and lands on the surface. Once an object or creature reaches the top of the area, it floats, caught between the normal and reversed gravity. The creature can move along the plane where the two forms of gravity meet. Creatures that can levitate or fly can use those abilities to mitigate the effects of reverse gravity.
When reverse gravity ends, all creatures and objects caught in the area fall back down. Likewise, anything that moves beyond the spell's area is subjected to normal gravity again.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBI9VWTz0fmU0HIzaK3_description
attribs.current: Tungort unravels the magic behind a spell or effect. Attempt a counteract check against the target. Counteracting a Magic Item causes it to become mundane for 10 minutes. This doesn't change the item's non-magical properties. If the target is an artifact or similar item, Tungort automatically fails.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBI9VWTz0fmU0HIzaK4_description
attribs.current: Opening a door that bypasses normal space, Tungort instantly transports itself and any items it's wearing and holding from its current space to a clear space within range it can see. If this would bring another creature with Tungorteven if it's carrying it in an extradimensional containerthe spell is lost.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBI9VWU6mZZdNwDuszH_description
attribs.current: Tungort befuddles its target with strange impulses, causing it to act randomly. The effects are determined by the target's Will save. Tungort can Dismiss the spell.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBI9VWU6mZZdNwDuszI_description
attribs.current: Opening a door that bypasses normal space, Tungort instantly transports itself and any items it's wearing and holding from its current space to a clear space within range it can see. If this would bring another creature with Tungorteven if it's carrying it in an extradimensional containerthe spell is lost.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBI9VWU6mZZdNwDuszJ_description
attribs.current:
Three illusory images of Tungort swirls about its space, potentially causing those who attack it to hit one of the images instead of it. Any attack that would hit Tungort has a random chance of hitting one of its images instead of it. If all three images remain, there is a 1 in 4 chance of hitting Tungort (1 on 1d4). With two images remaining, there is a 1 in 3 chance of hitting Tungort (12 on 1d6). With only one image, the chances are 1 in 2 (13 on 1d6).
Once an image is hit, it is destroyed. If an attack roll fails to hit Tungort's AC but doesn't critically fail, it destroys an image but has no additional effect (even if the attack would normally have an effect on a failure). If an attack roll is a critical success and would hit one of the images, one of the images is destroyed and the attack roll becomes a success against Tungort. Once all the images are destroyed, the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBI9VWU6mZZdNwDuszK_description
attribs.current: Tungort sees things within 60 feet as they actually are. The GM rolls a secret counteract check against any illusion or transmutation in the area, but only for the purpose of determining whether Tungort see through it (for instance, if the check succeeds against a polymorph spell, it can see the creature's true form, but it doesn't end the polymorph spell).

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBI9VWU6mZZdNwDuszL_description
attribs.current: The target can understand all words regardless of language and also speak the languages of other creatures. When in a mixed group of creatures, each time the target speaks, it can choose a creature and speak in a language that creature understands, even if the target doesn't know what language that is.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBI9VWTz0fmU0HIzaK1_heightened
attribs.current:
Heightened (2nd) The spell also disguises Tungort's voice and scent, and it gains the auditory trait.
Heightened (3rd) Tungort can appear as any creature of the same size, even a specific individual. Tungort must have seen an individual to take on their appearance. The spell also disguises your voice and scent, and it gains the auditory trait.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBj8YUZvsKALq-xhCAx_description
attribs.current:
While Bishop Keppira DBear lost her spellcasting abilities and other clerical powers upon being transformed into a strigoi, Urgathoa is pleased with the development and granted the fallen bishop a boon. In time, and if shes allowed to continue her undeath, the bishop may well regain many of her spellcasting powers as a cleric of Urgathoa, but until that time she can draw upon this connection to the goddess of undeath to utter a blasphemous invocation. When she does so, shadows within a 20-foot emanation from Bishop Keppira twist, writhe, and animate before lashing out. All living creatures in the area must attempt a DC 30 Fortitude save. Bishop Keppira cannot use Blasphemous Invocation again for [[1d4]] (1d4) rounds.
Critical Success The creature is unaffected.
Success The creature takes [[5d6]] (5d6) negative damage.
Failure The creature takes [[10d6]] (10d6) negative damage and is slowed 1 as their own shadows animate and pull against them.
Critical Failure The creature takes [[20d6]] (20d6) negative damage and is slowed 2 as their won shadows animate and pull against them.

attribs.name: repeating_actions-activities_-NBj8oqYHE0kTtzlIY1s_description
attribs.current: When drinking essence, Bishop Keppira DBear regains 15 HP.

attribs.name: repeating_spellinnate_-NBj91vdzzHjkXj2hzI8_description
attribs.current: Bishop Keppira D'Bear defies gravity and levitate the target 5 feet off the ground. For the duration of the spell, Bishop Keppira can move the target up or down 10 feet with a single action, which has the concentrate trait. A creature floating in the air from levitate takes a 2 circumstance penalty to attack rolls. A floating creature can spend an Interact action to stabilize itself and negate this penalty for the remainder of its turn. If the target is adjacent to a fixed object or terrain of suitable stability, it can move across the surface by climbing (if the surface is vertical, like a wall) or crawling (if the surface is horizontal, such as a ceiling). The GM determines which surfaces can be climbed or crawled across.

{"size":"Large","Token":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/files.d20.io/images/205138977/8Pvh6W45-EBFIpTMgnKOWg/original.png","level":"14","speed":"50","senses":"detect alignment, darkvision, see invisibility","traits":"Asura, Fiend","stealth":"25","Category":"Monsters","npc_type":"Creature","religion":"25","spell_dc":"34","Expansion":"9361","alignment":"LE","athletics":"24","data-List":"false","deception":"28","languages":"Common, Infernal; telepathy 100 feet","immunities":"curses","perception":"25","weaknesses":"good 10","armor_class":"35","description":"Asura
Asuras are, above all, proof that the gods are not infallible. These fiends arose as physical manifestations of divine accidents, taking form when the gods themselves stumbled and blasphemed on a cosmic scale. As a result of their own divine genesis, an asura loves above all to undo the workings of the divine. They eagerly travel to the Material Plane, seeking out temples, congregations of faithful worshippers, and religious orders of all stripes to sow doubt and destroy what the gods seek to build.
Asura Realms
Asuras command vast empires in the corners of Hell. While their realms are tiny compared to the massive hierarchy of Asmodeus and devilkind, they exist in a tacit agreement of coexistence with their diabolic neighbors. 
Asura Rebirth
Most creatures native to the Outer Planes dissipate upon their destruction, and their essence is absorbed by their home plane. Asuras, however, have a fate akin to reincarnation: a slain asura usually returns in a lesser form, eager to gain retribution upon their killer. Occasionally, exemplary asuras return in more powerful forms. 
Asura Ranas
Over time, the mightiest asuras complete enough cycles of reincarnation and commit enough atrocities over multiple existences to incarnate into the most powerful of their kind. These asura ranas are demigods in their own right, attracting vile worshippers and heretical cults among mortals.
Nikaramsa
Lies, knowledge, and deception are a nikaramsas stock and trade. They are outstanding scholars, with deep and nuanced understanding of religion, philosophy, astrology, and similar subjects. They take particular delight in exploiting the greed and hubris of gullible worshippers, using them to desecrate and destroy their own faith. Even in their goal of undermining the holy, nikaramsas twisted humor knows few bounds, and they prefer to take on the guise of divine messengers with boons to share. Once they find a likely victim or set of victims, they use their vast knowledge of religion to impart contradictory wisdom, leading to the eventual implosion of the faith from heresies of the clergy and congregation themselves. 
Cousins in Corruption
Many evil beings take interest in spreading heresies. While nikaramsas seek to unravel faiths from within, the devils known as deimaviggas strive to lure individuals away from the gods, and shrine skelms leverage religions for their own
